lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get into that story in a little bit, but because of that, we have some guests playing. This will be the second week of our two fantastic guests, Wil Wheaton and Will Friedle. We're excited about them. They're pretty nice. This is the second week of the Wills; we're excited to have them. Also, do we have any other announcements anyone wants to talk about? Anything crazy coming up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Speaking of the Wills, just to talk about the first two giveaways that we reached. That's it. Once it hits the board, it's done. It's like the American flag. These are TableTop nail wrap-specific.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh yeah, these are from our friends at Espionage Cosmetics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, these are Espionage Cosmetics nail wraps, and they're actual TableTop--

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, they're official licensed TableTop merchandise that we made happen. I'm very happy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So yes. Wear the support on your fingertips.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I have two announcements. Announcement the first: for the next four hours and 56 minutes, Pacific Time, I am the King of the Internet because I won yesterday on @Midnight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Also, Hardwick hipped me to this movie that I want everybody to see, so I'm telling everyone I know about it, and I won't shut up about it. It's called What We Do in the Shadows. It is a comedy that is a documentary about a group of vampires who live together in a house in Wellington, New Zealand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh wait, is this the one that has Jemaine Clement in it?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I've heard of this.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It is one of the most amazing, hilarious, pitch-perfect, well-done genre comedy and horror films I have ever seen. It is a delight, and I want everyone to watch it because I'm afraid it's not going to get the attention it deserves.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: This is a new movie? This isn't something from years ago?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: From this year, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This episode sponsored by What We Do-- no, I'm kidding.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Tomorrow, Friday, on Gather Your Party, I had a thumbtack comedy buddy, Alex Lewis, and Keith Habersberger--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's not a real name.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I know. From Buzzfeed. Together, they are Lewberger, and they're going to be playing here, and I'm going to be doing some songs with them and performing with them, as well. Check it out for Gather Your Party tomorrow. What time is that, sorry Zac?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tomorrow. Wondrous.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to announce that I am nervous as shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why? I can't imagine why you would be.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Is it because you're sitting so close to me that you're worried that you're not going to roll anything well tonight?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I should feel comfortable that you're going to soak it all up.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I can die, and it's fine.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's not fine.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It doesn't matter. No, it'll be dramatic and great. I plan to sacrifice my life for someone in this group who deserves it.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Spoilers!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hopefully you don't fail at that, too.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Not for you!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Not for you. No, not for you!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's a hug-worthy moment. This is a good day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only because of the dice, not because of your choices.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Too late!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So 826LA, our charity. Everyone should go check them out; they have amazing storefronts in cities all across the country. The one here is themed after time travel in Echo Park. And also in Marina Del Rey; that's the other city that I'm trying to think of. But yes, a portion of all of our donations go to them, and they're amazing, so thank you so much. And thank you for everyone who has donated in the past. We love you. And I think we are going to be doing a video. I know I've been saying that for a while, but we have a date scheduled now! It is happening. We have a way for everyone to get back in town, but it's going to happen, and we're going to have a field trip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, to 826 and deliver all your wonderful donations. Last announcement I have to make. Let's see. The wonderful folks at Midnight Syndicate-- for those who don't know who they are, they make fantastic music and soundtrack tracks. They've done an official DND soundtrack years ago, and they've done stuff for World of Darkness and Call of Cthulhu. They do great atmospheric music. They finally got back to me, and they gave me permission to use their songs on this feed, so my playlist expands even further. They're really cool guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long ago did you send that e-mail?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a while back. It was before we started the stream. But they responded, and they've been really cool about it, and if you're looking for your own soundtrack stuff to work on, they have a great array of stuff. I highly recommend checking out Midnight Syndicate.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are you still trying to get Queen, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm trying, but Freddie hasn't returned my e-mails.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Hey, guys? This is weird. He's not going to return your emails. No. He's not a fan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's more into Shadowrun.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: He's really a Shadowrun guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay, Shadowrun's cool.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Very much a Shadowrun guy.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I played that on Genesis.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to build bleachers back here. We've got this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We lost Wheaton.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: All right, so now we got a shot!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, step into camera if you're going to make such a big to-do. Come in and say hi, and then get out. You already pulled Wil out of the picture.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thorbir died really fast tonight. Yay, we got a Laura!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And by the way, unlike Thorbir, I did not trip over anything or fall down trying to go down one step.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Just so we don't mistake the actor for the character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. There's a distinction. It is a creative character. No buckets were harmed in the announcement here. All right, so. I think if we're all ready, let's go ahead--

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, I don't have a pencil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have a pencil? I'm going to throw a pencil at you.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Throw a pencil at me, dungeon master!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, gingerly hand it to our fantastic overlord, who will deliver it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, are we going into our intro?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Began to hear skittering and screeching sounds throughout the room-- hundreds of small ones-- while two large thorny tentacles jettisoned out of this, call it a dung heap if you want, and pulled itself to the surface, with a central body filled with teeth and one giant toothy maw. And that was where we left off. So. In the nature of that, I would like everyone to roll initiative.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Even those of us that are very quietly walking slowly? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can continue slowly on your turn, if you'd like. That's entirely up to you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Natural 20! Plus two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good start.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll take it. That's 20 for me.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Well, I guess that just leaves me, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Wil.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they're off!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We pick up where we left off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We never left.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: MIT is just going, come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note, because I forgot, guys. For subs tonight, every hundred subscribers we get, one person in the chat will be chosen to win a signed cast picture and a signed poster of one of our artists, Kit Buss's wonderful art pieces for Critical Role, signed by us, as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Espionage Cosmetic nail wraps!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we got some cool giveaways. Forgot that at the top. Anyway. 20 and up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Ten to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? All right.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, what do you have?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, okay. All right. As the skittering seems to go to a fervored frenzy, you can see masses and masses of extremely matted fur moving and quivering through this refuse as a series of rat swarms pour out of the edges of this giant dung pile. And where at the center that giant entity has revealed itself to be a terrifying visage of some kind. I'm going to have you go ahead and roll an arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Immediately, as soon as this creature comes out (squelch), this horrible guttural bubbling sound its throat makes as it pulls itself out of this nasty collection of refuse. You've read of this in quite a few tomes before in your travels. This is known as an otyugh.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An otyugh.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Nasty things, these otyughs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Usually riddled with disease, they're controlled garbage disposals for those that can keep control of them. And it is Kashaw's turn.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Do we get to know how dangerous they are to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You currently have no idea.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are these creatures dangerous to us?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So should we just try to get rid of everything right now, then, as it were?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: They're not even there yet.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: They're not with us at all yet, are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see. You have dim light, so you're fine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Whatever you do, don't go up next to it right now.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, can I cast some light? Turn on some light and see what we can see down there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he still has his Light spell.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, we're still lit up? Oh, okay. Good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see this creature now. (growls)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay. Now, is there any chance that any kind of spell that I cast could hurt them, even though we can't see where they are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It depends on the spell's radius. If it's relatively small, then probably not. They're not even within visual range, so you'd really have to try hard to hit them at this point.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And how about the rest of us, though? How close are we to this thing and this cylinder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all about ten feet away from this giant creature right now.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, that's a pretty tight thing. Okay. You know what, I think I'm going to try to at least slow this thing down as much as I can before everybody else gets down here. I think that's the best thing to do is just slow it down. I'd like to cast Sacred Flame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sacred Flame.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Kash money.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Kash money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's it require from you?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Let's see, it's one action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the target makes a dexterity saving throw. Let's see if it makes this. What is your spell DC?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: My spell DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should be at the top of your spell list.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, okay. It's a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. Okay, it does not make it. As you bring out your holy symbol for a moment from beneath your armor, you look forward and thrust your spear forward. This energy travels from the middle of your torso, across your arm, down the spear, and fires off as this burst of vibrant whitish-blue light that blasts into the front of this otyugh creature. You deal 3d8 damage to it. So go ahead and roll eight-sided dice three times.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Eight. Now we need the full set, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, they're all here. Here's an eight.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: All right, I got the eight here.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: If you need to roll a one, you can use one of mine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This one.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So three, right? Here we go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Big money, no whammies.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's all right. Eight and five and four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you wish to move, or do you want to stay where you are?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, I would like to move. Once I've struck, I'd like to get at least a little bit farther away from it to try to distract it from the opening where these guys might be coming down, so the opposite side of the opening where these guys might drop in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you can try and move closer this way, probably. You're now adjacent to one of the rat swarms, but you're pulling it away from the entrance here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they rats or are they ROUS's?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like normal-sized rats. Not that you would know, because you're not in the room, but there's clusters and clusters of these rats swarming over each other.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Were any of them affected at all by the Sacred Flame?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's just the singular target, but if you have things that hit larger areas, they can hit multiple guys. That ends your turn. Next up is Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I can move first, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll move around next to Kashaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next to him? Okay, you will get free strikes from both the rat swarms, currently, because you'll be passing through there and out of their melee range. You cool with that?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm not. Can I take a step back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. This guy will still get an attack of opportunity on you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Really? I thought I could move five feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use an action to disengage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. I won't do anything. Here's what I'm going to do instead. I'm sorry, I don't know what was wrong. I've been off, and I apologize for how I've been sounding. What I'm going to do is I'm going to lift my finger and I'm going to aim behind that three-headed bastard and I'm going to release a 4th-level Fireball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Show me with your laser pointer where you want the impact to be.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Behind him where it won't hurt Keyleth and will just hurt him. Wherever that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'd say that'd probably be right around this area here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to immediately spend two sorcery points and quicken spell, and I'm going to turn around and do three Scorching Rays to follow up the Fireball right at that dude, each head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to, on that spell, spend another--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait up, let's do the Fireball first.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One thing at a time. So as you use your ring, you focus. The ray streaks past. Slams into the wall behind (explosion sound) with a deafening roar, and you guys definitely hear this. The hallway in the distance suddenly brightens up, and you can see a bit of flame roll up, and the scent of smoke comes wafting past you as a wave of heat blasts through the tunnel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, he does that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC on your spells?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not make the save, so full damage on the otyugh.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wonderful, so let's see. Here's a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That rat swarm would also be hit.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Here's a five. Okay, so I'm going to now--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the damage on the Fireball?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on, I'm going to spend one sorcery point to empower the spell, and I'm going to pick the six and reroll these four dice, because I can reroll up to that many when I empower. For that damage. Perfect. What's the total for that, guys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Math. Wizard math.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Math has no power here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Math is for everybody, guys. Really.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is that? Nine. That's 24. And then (counting).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to pimp out a calculator for him one day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, abacus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After the fireball explosion settles, you can see there's a big char mark in the front of it. Some of its teeth have been blown into the inside of its mouth. The rat swarm behind Keyleth is completely incinerated with a hundred-squeak screeches, and you can smell charred fur and hair and flesh in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you burned my new robes! Ugh.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So I'm going to do that. Okay, and then the Scorching Ray happens. And I'm going to heighten that spell, which gives you disadvantage against the save? Is that what I want to do? Yeah, that's what I'm going to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It feels like you just did 17 things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no saving throw for it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Actually, I don't do that, then. I don't spend those points. I was supposed to do True Strike to make that work. d20s, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, so roll for each ray.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wonderful. Yeah, they all hit. I got a 14, an 18, a 19, and my spell attack bonus is plus 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I saw that DM move of, I'll tell you if it hits. I felt that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was there, and he was right. 6d6 fire damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ooh, that's gross, and I'm going to empower that spell, as well. So it's four, and I'm going to pick four out of these six-- no! I rolled a six. (counts quietly) 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 29? All righty. As each ray (impact sounds), you can see the flashing of the flaming light in the air. This darkened room is suddenly illuminated in bursts as each of these rays of burning fire go blasting into the side of the otyugh. It's nearly pushed back into the pile that it pulled itself from, but steadies itself. Does that end your turn?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Tiberius's turn has come to an end.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've knitted a sweater while Tiberius took his turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is going to do a bite attack and a tentacle attack on you, and a tentacle attack on Keyleth, as you're the nearest to it. So as it rears back with its mouth, this giant maw opens with all these nasty jagged broken teeth, and the smell that comes out of its mouth is horrifying, even for your experience as a dragonborn. That would be... 18 to hit.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Did you roll at disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why would I have disadvantage?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cloak of Displacement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But thank you for the reminder; that's good to know.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: AC is 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now go home and get your shine box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of piercing damage. As you (grunts) reach back in pain, you push yourself out of its mouth. I need you to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Okay, so you pull off and away. You can see where it dragged across your scales, it left this nasty trail of black-- whatever you would call it, saliva-- but you manage to slip it off your hand, and you feel like it's probably not going to bother you too much. However, as you steady yourself, one of the tentacles comes swinging down towards you. That is also with disadvantage. That would be a 21 to hit.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You take seven points of bludgeoning damage from the impact. That's only four points of piercing damage as the spines slam into your side and seem to stick onto you. You are also considered grappled and restrained for the time, as the tentacle wraps around you and the spines are digging into your body. It now has you by your waist and is holding you in place.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This is fun. How much damage is that, total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'd be a total of 11 damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Really? Plus the other damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus the bite, no. Did you not write down the bite damage I told you?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's 16, so 26? 27. So what's half of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Half of that?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Because of the Stoneskin. My Stoneskin is still up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stoneskin is still up. That is correct. How long does that last?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hour. Yeah, that should've lasted long enough. You're fine, yeah. So half of that would've been--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I cast that when we were chasing him--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. 13 points of damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. 13 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done, Tiberius. All right.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Spellcasters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will be a 23 against you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That turn's done. That'll be a total of 14 points of bludgeoning damage to you and five points of piercing damage, and you are also grappled by the other tentacles here. You are both currently being held to the sides of the creature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 14 and five, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. That brings us to Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're how high up from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 15 feet up, and you're that far back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're that far back? All right, so it takes my whole movement just to run to the edge probably, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your turn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that's it? Bonus action, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bonus action if you want it, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I can't see. Can I see past the lip of the edge to the top of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever you're trying to hit might have three-quarters cover.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sighs) That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moving in. Each one of these rats swarms start crawling up towards your body, and they're starting to find their way into your armor, and they're biting. It's a terrible experience. Swarm attacking Keyleth is going to be a 16 to hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. You brush them off yourself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at them and I go, (rat noises).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) The rat whisperer. Attacking you, Brother Kash. That looks like it's going to be a ten to hit?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay, so now what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: My armor class is where? There. It's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Against Tiberius, that is going to be, with disadvantage--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Man, they can't touch me. I'm up in the air, yo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're grappled, but you're not floating in the air.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Aw man, I thought he was whipping me around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 13, so it's going to miss you. So the rats, no effect yet. That ends their turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the tentacle that's grappled around me and I grab onto it, and I cast Blight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It has to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What level is Blight? Blight is 4th?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 3rd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, constitution saving throw. That is an 11. What's your DC? I'm pretty sure it fails.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it takes 8d8 necrotic damage. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, it does.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Nice work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where'd all my d8s go?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You gave them to me. You very nicely gave them to me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's one. Ooh, there's four, so five, six. Seven. I just like rolling all of them I could roll. Okay. That's all right. There's ten, there's 20, there's 35. Sorry. Yes, 36 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 36 damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! As you grab the tentacle, you can see the slippery, slimy flesh, and it has the residue on it. As your fingers grasp into it, its brownish-yellow color all of a sudden turns into this grayish sickly dried landscape, as you can see the flesh cracking to dust around it. The tentacle's still grasping onto you. The magical energy travels up the side of what would be its torso and body, and you can see it beginning to withdraw through severe pain. It manages to eventually shrug off any further spread of the magical disease, of the Blight, but it has left this horrible scarring across one side of its whole body. You can't really move this turn, since you're currently restrained.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you got?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm going to continue down this corridor to get close to the half-elf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a full round of movement there.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: That's all I can do. Leave something for me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends that. That's going to bring us to the top. Kashaw. Your turn.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Is the side that she damaged useless at this point? The one tentacle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's still functional, still wrapped around her. There's scarring across it and a large part of its upper torso. Torso. It's weird to say parts of its body when it has that strange construction.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Don't attach your body norms to it, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) I apologize.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you body-shaming that otyugh?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Shouldn't we? I'd like to move as much directly in front of the creature as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulls you right up in front of it, now. Its giant mouth is (chomping sounds) angrily gnashing and biting down in front of you, and it's sending bits of that brackish spittle across your face and smells horrifying. What are you doing?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'd like to try to take control of it with Geas. See if I can tell this bitch what to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Not you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was hoping you weren't talking about me.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'd never call you bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the casting time for Geas is one minute.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Knowing that, every combat round is equivalent to six seconds, so you could try it. It probably won't survive that long, but hold onto that spell for now. Is there another one you'd like to use?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I will hold onto that. Yeah. I think then I'm going to try... How about just another Sacred Flame for now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. It's going to attempt at making another dexterity saving throw. That is a 14, and that does not beat it, so go ahead and roll 3d8 points of damage to it. Radiant damage. Tiberius, you're on deck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, nice. Not bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn. That brings us to Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to cast True Strike on him. Cantrip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: True Strike on yourself?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: On him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to look for a weakness. That'll give me advantage on my next--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Attack roll against the target? Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Then I'm going to quicken spell and spend two more sorcery points to cast-- well, I'm going to look over. Can I see where Vax and him are coming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no way of telling that they've even arrived at this point.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I can see behind the creature, though, because that's within range. So I will do Misty Step behind him and get out of that grip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Misty Step is a 2nd-level?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. To where do you want to go?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As far away behind him as I can go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And that is my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Ending your turn, the otyugh turns around angrily. Now it looks, it has its empty tendril. It's going to step away. You do get one, Brother Kash, as it steps away. You get one free attack with your spear as it tries to move away from you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll an attack with your spear.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That is a d20? 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus your attack bonus.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Attack bonus is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, plus nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that definitely hits. So go ahead and roll damage for the spear.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Damage for the spear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which is 1d8 plus three.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: 1d8 plus three. Where's my d8? Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as it moves away (stomping sounds) you reach out and (whoosh) hit it with the spear, leaving this big old gaping wound in the side where more of its dark blood begins to spill out from the wound. As it moves over, it's going to go ahead and do one bite attack towards Keyleth with its open mouth. That's going to be a 24.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That's going to be 16 points of piercing damage to you, and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a 16?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That'll be a 19.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the second one hits you. That is eight points of bludgeoning damage and five points, so 13. Half that because of Stoneskin. That puts you at seven points of damage. And you are once again grappled and wrapped up by it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think he likes me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you pissed it off when you set it on fire multiple times in a row.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We could use a little help down here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coming!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends its turn. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are any of my friends right up against this nasty shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, Keyleth is right next to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth. So if it's occupied with my friend, I can take a second, aim really well, and sneak attack from up here. Okay, so that is 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? That hits, definitely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so sneak attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh good, you showed up!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nine. Plus 12, 17, 21. That's 21. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 points of damage. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the second dagger, which is Life-Stealing, hits with a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, definitely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. All right. You still have the rest of your movement if you want to stay up there or wish to move somewhere.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope, just going to perch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are currently restrained. Tiberius, you are also restrained, so attacks against you have advantage. That'll be a 19 against you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Against Tiberius, it just has a general attack roll because you give it disadvantage on attacks. That is going to be a 17, which I think misses you. All right. Keyleth, you take nine points of piercing damage as the rats are now swarming up over the side of the tentacle and biting at your neck and shoulder area, and you're trying to brush them off of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! (squeaking noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rats aren't your friends anymore. That finishes their turn. It is now your turn, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My turn? Okay, are rats swarming me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This guy's looking pretty close to dead, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's looking pretty hurt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's looking pretty hurt? I'm going to do it again. I'm going to do Blight again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Blight again against this guy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm still grappled, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So just same thing, I'm just going to (sucking sound) try and suck the life out of this guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a 13.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs, counts) I need one more, where's it at? Big money, no whammies. Ooh, that's not bad. Okay, so that's 14, 15, 16, 24, 30, 32, 35, 41, 45.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was once a very moist and warm vicinity gets strangely cold as now her hands embody the end of life. She grasps the tentacle, and the rats scatter as the proximity grows. As you touch it, you can see now what was once the Blight's scarring begins to fill the entire tentacle, and as it turns, it hardens around you, almost like a brittle piece of concrete. The rest of its body (cracking) you see it begins to (roars), starts thrashing about. Its tendril releases you, Tiberius, dropping you into a pile of refuse. As it reaches around to try and grasp its own tentacle, (shattering sound) it breaks through its own arm. As it reels back, you fall onto your butt, the rest of the broken pieces of otyugh crumbling into dust around you. You look up and see the creature as it attempts to back up, each one of its legs pulling up against the one door that's partially buried in the far corner. It slams into the side as the Blight spreads across its body. Its teeth begin to shatter and turn to dust within its mouth, which begins to slowly curl inward as it ages extremely rapidly in a short period of time. Suddenly, it slumps to the ground, (gurgling sound) and joins the refuse of which it once came from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thorbir?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You were supposed to save something for me!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There's a bunch of rats down here!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Rats!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Walk faster.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (clunk clunk) To the edge, there. How far down is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 feet. And it is soft ground.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Can I jump and land on those rats?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what? Sure. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on. You can do it.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Okay. 17.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's rats!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap, slam down on top of the rat swarm that just jettisoned off the side of Keyleth. I'm going to say for that impact, go ahead and roll 1d6. It takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage from you stepping on a few of the rats.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six! All righty. And they're now all around you on the ground and they're trying to swarm away from the impact zone. You still have your action.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Okay, so. I haven't played a character this high-level in this system, so bear with me while I walk through this. I believe that I can attack three times in a round, right? I have the extra attack feature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, as a fighter, you do. You have three attacks.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Okay, so I'm going to take my axe and just try to kill as many of these things as I possibly can. So I swing my axe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And I roll a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you swing your axe for the first batch of rats. Unfortunately, it's hard to see where the compost pile and the rats separate. You cleave through a bunch of the slimy mess, slinging a bunch of it against the wall, and as you spatter a bit against Keyleth, who's behind you. Roll for your next attack.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Very unhappy about that. Okay, three. How's that hole looking? It's a great hole, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You decide, as opposed to a small swath, let's make it a wider one, and your axe swings again. This time you catch a singular rat, but with the flat of the blade, and you send it flying about ten feet, where it comes back unharmed and joins the rest of its crew.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Just getting warmed up! And a one.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It can't be real! It can't be real.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is CG. That is computer-generated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This time, in an angry fury that you are being stifled by what is essentially sewer rats, you lift your axe up in the air as one rat has climbed up your pants bites you right in the crotch.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Don't touch it, don't do that. Okay. Yes, it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In pain, you drop the axe behind you and reach down and grab the rat and tear it in half out of frustration and anger, and I will give you a point of damage for that.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: A point of damage? The rat bit through my metal codpiece?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It snuck up past the small little gap there and ate through your leather britches, and you are in severe pain, nearing prone.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Well, I mean us dwarves are known for our dicks that are sensitive to rat bites.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true. They didn't put that in the Player's Handbook, but I think they're going to amend it, too.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, it's canon in my game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, Thorbir's turn is up.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, it sure is. Excuse me, I must inform the internet of my majesty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got your dick bit by a rat, son. You're a man now.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughs) You're a man now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Kashaw, you're up.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: First I would like to turn to Thorbir and say, are you kidding me?! How many rats are left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the group that is currently swarming around Thorbir, one immediately to your left that you're batting away with your shield, and one group that is currently trying to get all up in Tiberius's shit.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can we tell who's in the most danger at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most part, everyone seems to be doing okay. He's looking the roughest from a situational--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's just a bruised ego. That's different.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah. I think I would like to move to come to Strongcastle's defense over here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Stormwind.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. There we go. The rats do get a swing at you. That is going to be-- that's not going to hit. Once again, you hear the little small tings against the back of your armor, but it's not even a bother at this point. All right, what are you doing? You move up to the rats.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Once again, because again, people, I need some help. I'm a healer for god's sakes, so I'm going to try Sacred Flame again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no, it's a saving throw again. That's my end. The rats roll a one. Go ahead and roll straight damage on that. It's 3d8.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, the 3d8s. That's right. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Here are the d8s, right?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You know, if you're me, you only have to roll once.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's not that great. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage. You release it and you can see about 13, 14 rats get thrown and scattered, their lifeless burnt corpses (pattering sound) around, and the little hole that you left in the middle of that pile closes up as the rats form once again into a coalesced swarm. That ends your turn, I believe. That'll bring us to Tiberius.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill some rats.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What the hell are we in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a giant cylindrical-- it looks like it was once a cistern that has been turned into some sort of a refuse--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is there a roof?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can see? Roll a perception check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What do I use?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception. It's a skill. You don't use it very often.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you can see, it goes up maybe 30 or so feet beyond the radius of your Light spell and fades into darkness. You have no idea if there's a ceiling or end to it or how far it would be if there was one.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. Well, I've got one right next to me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to put out my hand and I'm going to do a Firebolt right next to that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll to attack with disadvantage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Why, are they on me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they're right up against you. Ranged attacks, when you're in melee with the target, it's at disadvantage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's what I'm going to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Avenge me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Obelisk of Stone puts you up on top there.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: About ten feet. And then I'll do the 2d10 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: d10s. Here's one.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: All right, I think I have one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll to hit first.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is it a d10? Do what now? Roll to hit first?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You need d10s.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, thank you. Is that a spell attack roll? That's 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31? Yeah, that hits. Swarm of rats: not too hard to hit, really.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cool, so that's 11, so that's 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? All right. You lift up onto your ten-foot platform as this stone pushes up from beneath all of the slime, and as it emerges, it sends this spilling cluster of whatever was at the bottom of this. You have to keep your footing as you go up. In fact, because of this room, I'm going to go ahead and have you roll a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is that, 12?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. So you get the attack off, but you lose your footing from the slick nature of the obelisk you just created, and you will plummet off and fall prone into the refuse to the side of the obelisk, but you still get the damage off on the spell. As you blast-- whoa-- and Tiberius, you tumble off the side. It's a soft impact. You only fall ten feet. It doesn't do any damage, but you are currently prone on the ground next to your obelisk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Refuse is code for shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe that ends your turn. You haven't moved yet, so you could technically use your movement to get up from prone if you wanted.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I'll do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm staying safe up here. I'm going to throw more daggers. There's a little pile under Thorbir's hiney? And a little bit out by itself, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right here, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they spilling out from under the dwarf's hiney? Or are they all hidden?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're all around him. They're sharing the same space.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not good. That's 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So a 13, that hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh hey, rats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rats are easy to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Usually, they are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So that's 21 and the second dagger is a ten, so 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31 damage total? All right. You notice that because of the nature of the swarm, what would normally be a creature that you could do a shit-ton of damage to, knowing its physicality, it seems like a lot of the physical attacks aren't as effective as you would like. However, this swarm has already taken a few hits, and as you carve through, dagger after dagger, eventually you pick off the remainder of the rats and the swarm is dissipated. The few ones that are stragglers, realizing that safety in numbers is missing, begin to curl their ways back underneath the piles they clawed from originally.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I was doing fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn? At the end of your turn, the other two rat swarms, also realizing the circumstance is bad, fight-or-flight kicks in and they flee and crawl back underneath.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Smart rats.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cheese!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (Mickey Mouse voice) Haha! I think I'm going to flee. Let's all swarm, come on, we can do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get back up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to hop down in the shit and loop an arm under Thorbir's arm. Come on, old man.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: How's your dick?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I don't want to talk about it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I Prestidigitate all the crap off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Is she still on the ground, or has she gotten up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've gotten back up. She's still spattered--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You ruined your new dress.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I got scorched by Tiberius's fireball.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You fought well, though.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm looking for the way out of here. I'm looking to see where the rakshasa went.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking on the far side, it's partially buried in the ground from the collection here, but you can see there is a bit of a push, like the door had been opened briefly and pushed things away, then slammed shut, and it's slowly starting to coalesce back towards it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Hold on, everybody. I walk right toward it, perception checking the area around it and the door itself. That's 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing strange about its presentation. However, upon checking the handle on the edge of it, it does appear to be locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Locked. All right, well, I pull out my little sack and I pull out one of these (twing) and go to work on it. That is a 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. In a matter of seconds-- this is an old-school lock, and one that is generally used for not very security-required rooms. Flick of the wrist, (click, creak) the door pushes inward a little bit and you have to get your strength in to push back the cluster of dried and liquid plant matter that is rotting against it, with just enough of a gap to push through into a dark room beyond, it looks like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I Fonzie'd it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did, kind of.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: (Fonzie impressions) Hey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, Tiberius, are you still lighting up this room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is currently the only light source, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so there's probably a little bit of light going in there, so I'm trying to look in to see what I can see from his spill-in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Glancing into the next room, you can see there's a little bit of a trickle of liquid that has spilled from underneath the doorway from this room. And you get the feeling this door isn't open very often, if at all, and the little bit of slime that has coasted through only goes about five, ten feet into a long stone hallway that disappears in the darkness no more than maybe 20 feet from you. Even with the low light, you can see pretty far. To the right and left of you, though: sets of iron bars.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Tibs. Follow that. Try and keep behind me. And I throw up the hood and go as low to the ground as I can, and I start to Gollum along the floor, looking at the ground in front of me in the dim light, trying to see if I can see any traps ahead of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. As you begin walking into the hallway, you go past, and you start to notice from the visual around you, there's smooth stone floor. The iron bars are all the way across with some partitions between. This is in particular a subterranean holding facility, some sort of an underground prison, and it's very quiet and there is no light in here. There are sconces set up, but it looks like there have been no recent torches set.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hear anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hearing? You hear nothing. It is absolutely still and quiet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab my earring. Let's do it. And I start moving forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I follow him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you guys continue with him?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I come up to the door and see what I can see with my darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can glance on the inside. You can see what looks like dried and brittle thatch that was once used to cover the floor has slowly molded over time. To your left, you see what looks to be elements of a skeletal corpse that was left for a very long period of time in the cell immediately to your left as you look through the doorway.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'll continue on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you enter this area and start stepping in, the air itself has a very chemical smell to it. It's hard to describe. There's something musty and untouched to the air, but there's also some sort of gentle hint of an acrid scent. Do you guys continue forward through this prison area?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking at the floor and everything as far out as I can see ahead of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's above us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking up, it's about 15 feet up, and it is another smooth stone ceiling. The construction here looks old. You, specifically, go ahead and make a perception check. With advantage, because you are a dwarf.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: 12 plus whatever. Do I roll again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, roll again. As you're a dwarf, and this is an underground stone structure.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, nine. So 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that's not bad. Looking at the stonework here, it's definitely created for function more than any sort of presentory functionality. You gather from looking at the nearby pieces of the stone wall that connects with the first set of metal bars that this was probably carved a few hundred years ago, and the metal bars as you move past-- you guys see this too-- the doorways that lead into these, some appear to be locked and some are completely open, easy to swing, and as you pull it open, (creak) very heavy rust against those iron doors, probably affected largely by the nearby moisture emanating from the room and whatever chemical's hanging in the air.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are we still lit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still lit by his Light spell, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And there's nothing really in the prison cells, with the exception of one skeleton?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that was in one room. If you want to go ahead and check around, go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought we would have seen it here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is balance to the universe. As you're walking past, Keyleth, looking over on one side, you see further up, with a bunch of the thatch pushed around it, there appears to be a corpse that doesn't have the layer of dust that a number of the other skeletal piles in some of the other cells seem to have. The door to get into the cell, though, does appear to be locked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax. Need your help; this is locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's in there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Looks like a fresh dead guy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. It's mostly covered with a lot of this thatch. It doesn't look like it was intentionally covered, but some sort of a struggle took place in this room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now for the door. Natural 20.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I work in mysterious ways.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The softer organs.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Is it wearing any clothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you inspect it, you look and see that while smashed with blood and dirt and dust, the outfit does appear to be that of a Duskmeadow Bastion.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel really terrible, but I'm going to give him the old half-elven pat-down and see if I can find anything on his personage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking about his entire body, anything of value has been taken.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can I speak with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can you what?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'd like to cast Speak With Dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Let's find out what killed him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can do that?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yes, I can do many things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's badass!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he's a dusk-what Bastion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Duskmeadow, which is the section of Vasselheim that worships the Raven Queen. The guys that you encountered earlier in the road? The dark, studded leather armor with the cloak swept over one arm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know he's dead, right?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I cast Annoyed Dwarf to know that he was likely killed by the rakshasa. Why are we standing in this room?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I want to know when he was killed.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm not stopping you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue casting the spell, there's a slight shimmer of greenish-blue light that slowly pours over the corpse, seeps into the bones, and for a moment you see Kashaw go into this trance-like state. Kashaw, you see from within the corpse, the face sits up with this horrible cracking bone-like sound. The skeletal element with this partially mummified and mostly rotten face steps forward, and the vacuous sockets that once held its eyes turn towards you, and you could swear you see the bone of its grimace grin as it airily whispers towards you, "Why do you bother me?"

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Because I have questions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What questions do you have?"

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What killed you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Something vicious, something untrue. It wasn't "what it seemed. This woman was asking for help, and no one's supposed to be down here if it's not "their route. Occasionally, we come and check on these abandoned parts of the prison. A woman was "here. A woman should not be down here. I went to ask what was wrong, and she took this from me." And the bony hand reaches up and gestures to the throat, and you can see there's giant claw marks across the front of its spinal cord where its neck is that give the sensation that something tore its throat out.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: A woman did this to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shapeshifter.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Or there's more than one. When? When were you killed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "14 weeks have passed. I was resting."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Anybody have questions? He's not going to be here long, I can tell you that. Not at 14 weeks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ask him if he knows which direction he went, and if he has a hideout.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Which direction she went, you mean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, he or she or whatever it was.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Did you see which direction she went after she killed you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She walked away, laughing and eating parts of me. I have not seen her since, but others walk "these halls. I've seen a dwarf pass through two or three times, and as it did and passed my cell, it "laughed. Sometimes guards come to inspect, but none have found me. None have found me yet."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are all the guards that come Bastions of the Raven Queen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We are the ones to protect the Amaranthine Oubliette. That is our job here. You sit in the "lower forgotten halls of the Oubliette. My final resting place."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Stormcloud? Any questions?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think we've learned all we can from this one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which direction was the dwarf walking?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You can answer her. What direction was the dwarf going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other hand creeps up from underneath the thatch. As you guys are watching this, the corpse is doing nothing, it's just lying there, he is talking to an unmoving corpse. For your vision, the hand reaches over and points in the direction you guys came from.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So it went the way we came.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That was two weeks ago."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But he said he's been coming and going, so maybe he was just leaving?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Coming the same direction we came from, though. That seems odd. And a man, a dwarf, and a woman.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Weeks ago. Not five minutes ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The spell fades, and the corpse falls back to its original pose, jaw left open, aghast in its final moments.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thorbir's right. We're burning time. We need to go in.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Go in where? Do we go back the direction the dwarf came?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I rolled a 23 arcana check on Thorbir's jeweled knife that he gave me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so you guys are aware, you are essentially in this vicinity of the prison. This was the room where you found the corpse, here. And you've seen just enough light begin to reveal there is a secondary prison room up here.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'm sorry, but we came from that direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this door, yes. This would've connected right there.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Every second we're here, it's getting away.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When we're in there, you keep it busy, and I will carve it up.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I will keep it busy.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Try not to get your dick bit by a rat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slide past Tiberius, crouch down to the ground again, and start scuttling along the ground. Looking, listening.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What was the ruling on the arcana check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The jeweled knife that Thorbir gave me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The knife does not appear to have any sort of magical aura about it. It's just a very well-crafted and probably relatively expensive piece of functionality or ornamental use. It's a very fine blade, though. It would be a fine thing to enchant, if you were inclined to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Kashaw. How close are you to your god?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: At one time, very close. Now? I don't think you'd want to be anywhere near her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And which god is that?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: My god is called Vesh, and I am the only one on the planet who has ever heard of her. Yeah, she killed everybody else. Want to talk to her?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No. Neither do I.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why did she spare you?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Because I'm her husband.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. How is that, being married to a god? That's rather inconvenient.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And how does that happen in the first place?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thorbir sighs heavily and steps into the room, and follows Vax.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can walk and talk. You guys go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're walking forward.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: She married me at birth. My mother was told that I was a special child, which is why I had the yellow eyes. I had two when I was born. We were married at birth. She killed everyone in the village. On my 15th naming-day she came to consummate the marriage. I made the first 50 slashes on my right arm. She made the next 50 for a ritual called the Sting of the Hundred, and when my blood mixed with her sweat, I gained all her memories. That's when I found out she was essentially the devil. I was raised as a healer because I wasn't just supposed to be her husband, but also her balance, because the universe wouldn't accept somebody as black as her in it. Tried to kill her at 15. Haven't seen her since.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ooh. So it's not like you can ask for a favor, I suppose.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I suppose I could, but there's a good chance she'll kill you, me, and everyone around at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point in time, as you guys are having this conversation, you moved up and looked and you can see there are two humanoids walking from this direction further down this hallway, which you can see leads this direction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to imagine that Thorbir and Vax left that conversation behind a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Big thick brown beard, hair pulled back into a ponytail, and they're both lightly conversing to each other. Not paying much attention, like they're running through a routine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just trust me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Okay. As you're pushing everyone back, (shushing) whispering all this, you hear a voice say, "Hello? Hold on. Hello?" The one with the beard approaches with his hand on his weapon, the other one moving along the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did I get them into the cell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pushed them far back and into the cell?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that was what I wanted to do, just backwards to everybody.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, and as this is going on, I dissipate the Light spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Light spell vanishes. He walks up and turns the corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give everybody a group hug with my Cloak of Elvenkind and try to make a big rag pile out of this corner. I'm very uncomfortably pressed against Thorbir's backside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The cloak can only really cover you and partially another person. The rest of you all make a stealth check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So who's it partially covering?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs) Thorbir.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thorbir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's not enough to really effectively do it to another person. It's just more for flavor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the thought that counts.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And my stealth is two, so that's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, all right. So the guy walks into the room, looks back and forth. The one behind him steps forward into the room a bit. The other one steps behind him. Looks about. Looks from one side of the room, looks over to your room. There's almost a glimmer of recognition in his eye, and continues walking past. They just start walking back the direction you guys came from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other one--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I throw up a Wall of Stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To lock them in.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That wasn't quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wall of Stone goes up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (muffled) What the fuck?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: How long does that last?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's permanent!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's time to move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, back around the corner, following around, looking, listening. Everybody the same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That chemical smell is getting stronger and stronger. It's burning your nose a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So Kashaw. If you're the only one who knows about this goddess, that means she also killed your parents?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yes. Thank you for bringing that up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception? I got you, baby. Well, that was perception.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: So I'm attempting to make a perception roll to see if I can pull anything out of these smells, maybe based on my experience with smithing and the chemicals that are associated with all that sort of thing, but I did roll a three. So I guess I would add a three. The best I can get out of that is a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because it's not sulfurous, it doesn't have something similar to what you'd find in smithing in your experience, at the very least. It's hard to really place where it comes from. You said you're going which way?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Towards that other door that they did not come out of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This here? All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 23 I rolled, perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. You approach the door. This door is locked. It does not appear to be trapped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's unlock it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you reach down to the lock and you place the picks inside, start fiddling, you look at the iron around it, and the actual metal seems to be frosting over. You pull back your head, and as you exhale, your breath becomes visible and the temperature seems to drop significantly, and as soon as you look up at the wood, something shimmers in the wood, and it's a humanoid face that just pushes out of the wood.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I use Uncanny Dodge to roll backward right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Do we see this happening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are hearing his reaction to this just happen in the front, there. I'm going to go ahead and say sure.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are there torches down this hallway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So one of the hands comes through, reaching out for you, this ghostly arm just swings towards you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I say, nope!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd like to have everybody roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, again? Man, we're going to run into everything.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are there torches in this hallway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Lighting, open flame of any kind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So we have 20 or higher? Anyone?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 20 to 15? 15 to ten?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I had ten, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. All right, nine to five?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 11, as well. I roll back, going (squeals).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Tiberius, you're up first. As you see these two drifting humanoid translucent ghostly entities drift out the door that Vax was at as he leaps backward, a second one drifts out of the stone down the hallway and turns towards the group, both of them giving these horrible low moaning sounds. (moans) Their feet are dragging about a foot off the ground.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll point to the one coming from opposite of Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That guy, all right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And then I'm going to do True Strike on him. And I'll back away!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back away.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's good. That's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool. All right. They go next. This one is going to drift forward. Now, the one that swiped at you, as you dodge backward, it drifts forward and its arms reach out for you and attempt to pierce the front of your chest. Go ahead and make a charisma saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I will do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you do the same as the spirit suddenly--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A charisma saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Flickers and appears right before you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA, WILL
lines.text: (cartoonish ghost noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as both of these ghostly entities (whoosh) completely slip into the physical form of Vax and Keyleth, who each shudder for a second as their eyes glaze over. Both the entities are no longer visible. However, you feel the presence of a cold, invading mind full of anger and distant loss and rage fill your brain, and your body is not your own.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is going to be fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth turns around and snarls at the rest of the group, this twisted grin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thorbir, you're up.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I am going to make a goading attack to try and draw whoever's closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closest to you would be Keyleth. Keyleth is right next to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't even know what to do.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, so I'm just going to make a goading attack, and if I hit, then they come after me. Or she comes after me. I'm pretty sure I don't hit. I don't know why I'm rolling. Sorry, that's a four on my first roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Use this one; it's quicker.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, plus ten. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 versus Keyleth? What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. That hits Keyleth.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Sorry about this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. Just keep me alive, Cashew.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Can I pull the attack to not do as much damage? I mean, other than the way I usually roll dice. Can I hit her with like the blunt side of the axe--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can say subdual damage. It'll still damage her.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Okay. Should I roll my regular attack dice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, your regular attack dice.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of damage to you, Keyleth, as you get smacked broadside with the blunt edge of Thorbir's axe. You see this happening, and in your head you're screaming, trying to push this out, but no matter how hard your will imposes itself, your body is not your own. You feel like you're restrained in a dark closet, watching from a distant hallway as somebody else controls your body.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: So I have to expend a superiority die, and I add this-- yeah. Oh, fuck you! Now you're going to work? So that's nine more points. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine more points of damage on top of that.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And then the target needs to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I will make that the ghost creature. That is a 16.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC on it?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I don't know. It doesn't say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is this for your battlemaster, for goading attack?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goading attack with battlemaster.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Sorry, nerds. I don't play this version.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would it be his wisdom?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: My wisdom saving throw is two. My wisdom is plus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Oh, the DC is eight plus your proficiency bonus, which would be 12, plus your-- what's your strength modifier?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four, so that'd be 16. 16. So yeah, it just makes the saving throw.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh. Well. Glad I wounded my friend for no good reason. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It makes its saving throw?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: So it makes its saving throw, so nothing happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so that was your first two strikes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So he just punched me for no reason?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I don't want to hurt anybody.

lines.name: MATT

You would have to target them physically.

Tiberius, you have the same visual on this, though a little part of your brain says, wait. You've seen Pike do something that scared undead before. Top of the round, brings us to Tiberius.
