lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four, so 13 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It adds to the damage roll, not the attack.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Damn it! I keep looking at it and expecting it to change.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. Your first attack hit. You have two more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 does not hit, unfortunately. It beats away the edge of your blade with one of its giant fists.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And my last attack. 23?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits. As it pulls back from knocking away your blade, you use the inertia to spin it around and come down on top with your axe.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: This is at your discretion, but I can add a d10 to my attack roll after I've made the attack roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You add it before I tell you if it hit or missed. So you can roll and be like, "I don't know "if that will hit or not. Let me add my dice to it."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I get it. So I'm going to hit again. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starting to knock some damage into it. You can see it's taken a little wear and tear. It's still pretty hefty, but you're starting to dig into the shield guardian. Does that end your turn?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Can I use second wind? It says I can take it as a bonus action, but I don't know how bonus actions work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get one bonus action every turn, if you have an ability that uses one.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, great. So I get hit points equal to d10 plus my fighter level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: 11 plus ten is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back at the top. That is Hotis's turn. Hotis begins looking at itself. It moves. It gets an attack from you, Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that does hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Piercing damage again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You strike. Once again, as it runs by, you get a chunk out of it and it (grunts) growls in anger and pain. You notice at the same time that she takes the bite out of it, the guardian shudders, like it suddenly took an impact on its own. As it charges away, though, it runs out of the field of Silence... It is going to begin casting a spell on itself, and immediately drifts up toward the ceiling. It is now currently flying in the room about ten feet up right now.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: He's flying now?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I can do that, too!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to end its turn. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use my bonus action to hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Remember, in order to properly hide, you would have to go somewhere where you would remain out of the sight of the individual.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I squat down behind Kash?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wait, whoa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, you tell me. I don't know how bright or dark it is in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hiding behind another party member is a little hard to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I run, Naruto-style, low, now he's behind me, toward the statue and crouch at the base of it? And then shoot up from there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Thanks to your stealth roll, the guardian does not see you. It can't get a reaction, anyway, because it's slowed from you. So yeah, you're able to scoot around to the side there, and then fling the daggers around the corner. The rakshasa apparently has not noticed you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. First roll was a 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, and it does do sneak attack damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Good job, Lara! I mean, Vax.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill this thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (counts quietly) 38, for the one dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, at the same time, the shield guardian doubles over for a second. The link appears to be sharing the damage between the two of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Piercing damage, yo.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: When you hit either one, or just when you hit the rakshasa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently, just when you hit the rakshasa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rakshasa, you can see, is clutching its side now, and there's blood beginning to pool around its robe and it (pants) is looking around with nervous eyes. That brings us to the end of Vax's turn. Kash, you're up.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Who's over here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No, near the shield warrior. Who's over there? The shield guardian.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is Thorbir and Vax.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to move a little bit. Even though he's floating, I can still move closer to the rakshasa, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I want to move a little bit closer and then cast Spiritual Weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What weapon would you like to create?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: How about a giant mace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you clutch your holy symbol to yourself, now there's a sudden pillar of bright, vibrant healing light surrounded by that same halo of pitch-black darkness, almost like this strange border around it. This duality hits the ground, and as it vanishes, you can see on the ground this shimmering, almost static-y mace is left behind, almost flickering in and out of existence. It drifts off on its own and is now hovering in the air next to you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you wish to send it up?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I do. I wish to send it towards the rakshasa. Concentrate all fire on the rakshasa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What's the damage on the magical weapon?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: When I cast the spell, I can make a melee spell attack against a creature within five feet of the weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so roll a d20 and add your spell attack bonus.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Spell attack bonus is-- 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits. Roll damage. It's 1d8 plus five, which is your spell bonus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All those blue guys. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give him the Al Capone, Kash.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Five and five, so ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Ten points of damage. All right, so as it slams into the side, the rakshasa (gasps) takes the brunt of it to its arm, and the shield guardian shudders slightly in the distance.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It says that now I can, as a bonus action on my turn, move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against the creature within five feet of it. So can I swing it around and attack him again from the back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use your bonus action to do that, yes. So it drifts behind and makes a second strike. Roll a d20.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: A d20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A d20 to try and hit. And add your spell attack bonus.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Ten. Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? This time, the rakshasa's a little more wise to your plan. As it swings around, it actually uses its Fly to dip down as it swings, and then comes back up around in its place, gliding and staring at it with a snarl. (snarls) I believe that ends your turn. Now the shield guardian turns this way and now it's taken notice of the rogue that has run up and eviscerated a portion of its master. It's going to pivot in place and bring both fists right down towards you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to uncannily dodge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What does that do, again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once a round, I can halve the damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For one attack, right? Well, that one will be a 25 to hit?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that will be a 14 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bludgeoning damage, which is halved to eight damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What's above us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Above you? It's about a 15-foot ceiling. 15 to 20-foot ceiling.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. Any light coming down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing in particular, no. You just have the wall sconces up there. This room has been repurposed from its original construction and hidden away. It looks like it was initially some sort of storage or altar room, based on how it was designed. All right, that ends its turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, the first one is a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sorry. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is this a pounce?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can it be a pounce? Was I far enough away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you move back and then pounce, you could.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then fuck yeah, it's a pounce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the movement to do so. So you back up, (growls) leap, and pounce on the shield guardian.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So does he succeed his strength saving throw, DC 14?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope! Not with a three.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then he is knocked prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact noise) Slow and prone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tiberius, you're up. Strangely enough, none of this makes any sound. It's a silent battle. It is the creepiest, quietest fight over here right now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Rakshasa! The butthole. And smash the shit out of both of them! 20 feet high. Maximum height.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'm looking up the spell real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dex save.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's a dex save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a natural 20 for the rakshasa, and that is a six for the shield guardian.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So he's pinned to the ceiling, and they both take 21 damage.

lines.name: WILL, MARISHA
lines.text: (laugh)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What's that weird James Gandolfini breathing next to me? It's really bizarre.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm clarifying this because the spell says this. They make a dex saving throw, or they're lifted by the pillar. If they make a save, they are not touched by the pillar.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Right. That means they don't get pinned by it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they don't take any damage. If they make their save, they dodge out of the way. That's how the spell is designed.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's primarily intended to be a defensive spell that can occasionally be used offensively, if they fail their save. The shield guardian takes the damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And he's pinned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he's pinned, currently. Yep.

lines.name: WIL, WILL
lines.text: Nice move.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Get him, Stormchaser.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The rakshasa dodges out of the way, and there is now a giant pillar in the middle of the room.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I look at him, and I'm like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That ends your turn, Tiberius? Thorbir, you're up.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Can I hit the guardian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, it is pinned against the ceiling, so you cannot hit it.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Right, so I can't do anything. Can I just delay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can if you want to. You can use your action to hold off until something triggers, which could be moving into range, in case you could then take your action on it.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'll do that. I can't get the rakshasa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from that distance, no. So you'll wait for this thing to try and find its way out. All right, cool. So that brings us to the top: the rakshasa's turn.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (mouthing words)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, because of the Silence. I'll dissipate the spell so I can hear him. Were you trying to say something, Thorbir?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (shouting) And I will be naked and riding through the desert-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rakshasa finishes scanning the room for a second, and he says, "Well, this has been a lot "of fun. I appreciate this little scuffle. However, I have other business to attend to. Looking at the "rest of you, at least I know where to hit you all the hardest. I know you have a father you seek. I "know you have family in Draconia. I know you have a sister that is not too far from here. And you. I "know you have one you hold dear to your heart. I can now see your minds, see their faces, and I "will see them soon. However, I must say adieu." And he begins to cast--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: 4th-level Counterspell!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiberius!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You already used one 4th-level Counterspell from your ring earlier.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, and I have two stored in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you have two 4th-level Counterspells in a ring that can carry up to four levels of a spell?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No. I can carry five up to 4th-level spells. It's my Ring of Spell Storing. It can carry up to five spells that go up to 4th level.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's not how it works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can carry up to four levels of spells.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't understand that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can do four level-1 spells. You can do one level-4 spell. You can do two level-2 spells.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's not how it worked before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a level-5 Ring of Storing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to Dungeons and Dragons. It's all good. You have Counterspell as a spell you know, though, right?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah. Still 4th-level Counterspell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me double-check one thing real fast, because this will make or break the circumstance, really.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As a matter of fact, no. 6th-level Counterspell. (growling) You will go nowhere!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's far as I can go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We go to 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It is a 7th-level spell, so let's go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Do I have advantage or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Don't roll yet.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughs) That's awesome. Okay. He's in charge!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so roll a d20 and your spell-casting ability is five for this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't piss off Tetsuo, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you roll a d20. Add a five. I will say you have advantage on this because you were expecting and waiting for this, so go ahead and make your first roll. Roll one at a time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, take that 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits this opening gate. The gate then fluctuates and shuts. At which point, the rakshasa goes, (quiet growl) and for the first time, really, in this entire battle, looks genuinely scared.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking kill it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You were saying something about my sister?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (shouting) No one threatens a goddamn Stormwind!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What he said.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't break your hand! It's going to fly-- actually, it's going to fly toward the door.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Towards the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. That's all the movement it can get, there, but it is heading towards the exit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, he's fucking trying to leave!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He suddenly turns pink and says, (Snagglepuss impression) exit stage right, even! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Vax's turn.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Come on, Vax! Don't let this bitch leave!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far is he from that statue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this statue here? At that height, I'd say it's about 30 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 30 feet? Okay. He's not paying attention to me. Can I use my bonus action to go stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're partially obscured by the statue. I'd say you can do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. With advantage. Come on, you fucking motherfucker. That is 28. And I'm throwing daggers at the back of his head. Yes. That is a 27. Do we call that sneak attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did not see you stealth, actually. He did not roll high enough perception, so you have sneak attack on him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ugh, I'm out of alcohol. It's the worst time to be out.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Druid needs booze badly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 damage? How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got the dagger in my hand, right? I see him flying away. I'm crouched down. I flip it over so the blade's in my hand. I don't go fast. I just take my time, pull back, throw it harder than I usually do, through its neck, out the front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (thud) It falls to the ground, taking a serious impact fall and is now, (grunts) dragging itself towards the exit of the room as you start walking up to collect your blade. (coughing, gasping) It brings up its hand to start trying to cast a spell. (wet choking sound) It coughs this big pool of blood onto the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You talk about my sister again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (death rattle) With a spray of crimson across the ground and this horrible sucking sound, you pull back the head as the life force of the rakshasa comes spraying across the stone floor. As you release it and leave it to the ground with the last bit of life left in its body leaves its form, you hear this chuckle. "I'll find you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I boot it into the acid.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No, we need the eyes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sizzling sound) You guys run over really quickly and pull it out.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What were you thinking?! (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't push my buttons, man.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Has the animation gone out of the guardian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shield guardian that was currently struggling has gone limp, pinned against the ceiling.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Nice work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I go over to it, and I bust out my book, and I start harvesting all the parts we need. Who's got the contract? What all do we need?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Who has it? I don't have the contract.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I never touched it.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We need the eyes. I didn't have the contract.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You had the contract.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I did not. You were in charge.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I was not in charge. I was never in charge. I was sent here to be a babysitter.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's in charge, as far as I'm concerned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does nobody have the contract?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is it behind us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, come on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We signed it, after, and left it somewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It might have ended up in the storage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, the actual, physical--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The actual, physical contract.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might have ended up in storage.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Someone from production made us sign it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here it is, clearly, right here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fangs and the tongue.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Ah, yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We found it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would have been a real shame to get all this far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got it. Cool.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We got it. It's all good. What do we need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're fine here. Everything's fine.

lines.name: WIL, LIAM, WILL
lines.text: How are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I have my book, which I think gives me advantage, I think is how it works?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gives you advantage on those, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Okay, gives me advantage. So I have to do this individually for each one, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Roll two at a time to make it more expedient.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's with advantage, so the first roll's a 20. That's for the eyes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's for the eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without a problem, pop both eyes out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tongue. I'll also take that natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a purpose you serve.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And it's the balance on the sides of the room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take that.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I am good for something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And for the heart. That's 16 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? All right. With some difficulty, you manage to eventually tear the heart out of the chest cavity. It's a very nasty process, and most of you guys-- well, not so much you guys; you've seen a lot of crimson, but watching this little druid girl, seemingly unfazed by the process of tearing into the chest of this rakshasa, is very disconcerting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Mononoke.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, hold this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it is this dark, dull red, like overcooked meat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. The claws. Oh, I'll take that 19! 30. Oh, sorry. 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take each one of the hands of the rakshasa, the back-turned, strange, upside-down humanoid hands, and cut them off at the wrists, very cleanly, and both are harvested without issue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the canine teeth. I'll take that 15 for 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 total?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take the rest of the head. You can see this terrible grin, this perpetually pulled smile from its final moments. You manage to pull out, very cleanly, both of the canines from the inside of the mouth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiberius? Do you have any vials left over? Empty vials?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I try and harvest some of the blood, as well, to keep for personal use?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's exactly what I was going to do.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (gags) For the love of-- (gags)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Filling some vials.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you squeamish about blood, Kashaw?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'm a healer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a little difficult, since a rather large portion of the rakshasa's blood is currently spattered across the floor, thanks to Vax. You manage to harvest one vial of its blood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One vial?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One vial.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to take my dagger out, and I'm going to shave trimmings from his fur and his whiskers. I'll take those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You currently have a vial of rakshasa shave scum.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I take the jeweled dagger, and I walk down to the corpse of the rakshasa. I drive the dagger through one of the eye sockets, and I say, you will never harm my daughter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dagger is left there as a proclaiment, and all of you feel the weight behind that whispered statement and decide it might be best to leave that dagger where it sits.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Let us conclude our business.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Very good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you've completed the harvesting, you notice the contract, the sigils that currently lock it, flash and seem to vanish from the paper, your contract completed. For the sake of brevity, you all manage to make your way-- arduously and with much difficulty-- not through the Amaranthine Oubliette, because that would be difficult, but retracing your steps back through a tunnel which has been sealed shut by iron pillars.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Fireball, fireball, fireball. Breaky, breaky, breaky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a terrible idea. Creating explosions in small, enclosed, earthen tunnels is a really good idea.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughs) No problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They completed the contract, but then all suffocated due to a sudden cave-in. It was so unfortunate, the second team.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I had a bottle of air!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is the worst fate ever for a PC.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gather around. Watch what I can do! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a long time to retrace your steps and find your way through the entrapment, especially since as you remove the iron pillars, the boulder then begins to roll past, so you carve your way through. You make your way precariously back to the Velvet Cabaret, back into the room where the rakshasa once lived. Do you wish to walk into the center of the Velvet Cabaret, covered in various fluids?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Fuck yes, we do.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, I think absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (boof) The door slams open and you all step into the center of the Velvet Cabaret. As you do, two of the guards turn and see you exit. "Hey! Hey, wait! What are you doing?" And they go for their blades to the side.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Seriously?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I turn around and go like, you really don't want to do that, friend. Trust me, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, what is that? 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? He rolled a three. He looks to the other guy. "As long as you're leaving."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thorbir just keeps walking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sheathes the sword, and they give a wide berth. You can hear the music playing, and everyone's laughing. As you enter the room, the music comes to a stop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right before we leave, I turn and have a piece of pelt from the rakshasa, and I throw it at the guard's feet, and I say, here. That's what's left of your boss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another who's watching says, "They bought that down at the market." The guards take it and lift it up with the blade and look strangely, and you see, coming out of the far corner, the bashful owner of the establishment that you had previously knocked unconscious, looks out. Not wanting to engage, just watching you as you leave with a look of fear on his face. You step out onto the thoroughfare, close the door behind you, back into the Quad Roads district, making your way towards the Slayer's Take guildhall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On the way out, I grab two glasses of ale, and I hand one to this guy and just walk and don't say shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one argues.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thorbir is genuinely touched by this gesture.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I assume that this means the contract went well, right?"

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It's done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a canvas bag and I plop it on the table, full of the rakshasa bits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you for your effort in keeping these fledglings alive."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: One more insult, madam, and you will find your whole establishment on fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm not in the mood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not meant as an insult. I'm sorry, perhaps you do not understand that we speak with "terms of endearment."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Well, in that case, I take it as a compliment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. So, looking at the contract. Is everything hopefully in order?" She takes it from you, looks into the contents of the bag. "Very well. You shall be paid out in full and scattered "amongst your party as you see fit."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And our counterparts? The rest of our party, have they returned? Have they checked in yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been gone for about as long as you have "been. You've returned faster than they have. Let us hope that they are safe. But I have faith. They "seemed very intent on completing this without issue, so I would not be too worried. I will "notify you upon their return, though."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Where are you staying?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are we staying?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I thought as members of the Take, you got to stay here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You could, if you like. We have room, and technically, as of this contract, you are all "officially members of the Take. You may stay here, if you wish."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I need a bed. And I motion towards the thing. I'm sleepy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll wait here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. We shall hold off the ceremony for when the rest of your team arrives."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: If the rest of this team is half as good as these members, the Take has grown much stronger this day. They're worthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 1,020 gold each.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 1,020 gold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You can split up my take amongst them. I take it my obligation has been fulfilled?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It has."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You know I have no desire to stay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you insist. But you know that whenever you come back to our little humble abode, you "always have a place to stay and work at your disposal, Brother Kash."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you. He turns and looks at the rest of his party. Well. It's certainly been interesting.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It has been a pleasure and an honor, Kashaw. You as well, Thorbir. You are brave warriors and would do well in the Draconian Knights.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you, Stormwind.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He said my name right!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Turns, winks, and walks out of the room.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thorbir sighs heavily and is annoyed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What a button on the night! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been an absolute pleasure, man.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thanks very much. Like I said last week, it's weird. This is out of my comfort zone, to be in this place. But yeah, this was really fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Thank you for coming to be a part.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah. And I'm glad that you all got to see that the legends are true.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's mind-boggling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so insane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Absolutely surreal.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dice aside, great character.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth got her first kiss!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was so awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Will Friedle, guys, who had never played.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, yeah. I've never played. This was a ton of fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And then vanish like a thief in the night!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Moments that Keyleth has dreamed of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn, guys. All right, so we have our donation list for the evening.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Lots of donations tonight.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We fucking lived!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How was the kiss?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. I got pink in the face. In real life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You two totally made out on graph paper.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You did!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I want to see that artwork.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it's coming. I heard the sound of 300 pencils going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a cowboy who just rode into the sunset, you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ship. He just shipped all over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Darin, get in here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kash money! (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I know what you've got to do to get invited back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For all you Warcraft players, you've probably killed him as Blackhand in Warlords of Draenor.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: How dare you?! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [end of captions]
